description: From nonsense syllables used in scat singing, 1940s.

entries.meaning: (music) An early form of modern jazz played by small groups and featuring driving rhythms and complex, often dissonant harmonies.

verbs.description: bebop (third-person singular simple present bebops, present participle bebopping, simple past and past participle bebopped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To participate in bebop jazz, such as by dancing in a way associated with the genre.
(intransitive, usually with a directional preposition) To walk in an easygoing, carefree manner.
